column3:
Automatic sanity-testing: FAILED BUILD/TEST, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/fa94a2ee7a3610c285ba57e02938aa05172cf5dd for binaries and test log.

This could happen for one of several reasons:
1. It chanages paths in makefile.linux-mingw or otherwise changes build scripts in a way that made them incompatible with the automated testing scripts (please tweak those patches in qa/pull-tes
Looks pretty good, based on a 60-second, untested review ;p\n
Agree with the first two commits; --with-system-leveldb is a bit controversial, as it may nudge distro packagers the wrong way. There's a good reason that we include our own copy of leveldb.\n
I have to agree that --with-system-leveldb sends the wrong message to distributions.\n
Perhaps an AC_WARN would be appropriate.\n
@luke-jr you know just as well as us that they'll just ignore that\n
